title: Ravi traveled 4 km straight towards south. He turned left and traveled 6 km straight, then turned right and traveled 4 km straight. How far is he from the starting point? - Quora

response.answer_text: Starting point A, first left turning point B, second right turning point C and final reaching point D . So AD is the measure of how far he is from starting point. As AB= CD= 4 km so AD will cut BC at middle point (say M). BC=6 km , so BM=3km AM= √ (4^2+3^2)=5 km AD=5×2=10 He is 10 km far from starting

This is simple geometry. Draw the lines on a paper sheet. Add a line between the extreme ends to show the distance moved. Complete a right angled triangle using the distance as the hypoteneuse.
